titleInfo.title: 'File 14/11 I Re: Security, Deposit, Accounts etc in the Post Office Savings Bank; Rules'

physicalDescription.extent: The papers in the file are arranged chronologically. There are notes at the end of the file, on folio 13. The notes are arranged chronologically and refer to documents within the file; they give a brief description of the correspondence with a number, which refers back to that correspondence in the file.

Foliation: the main foliation sequence (used for referencing) commences at the front cover with 1 and terminates at the inside back cover with 14; these numbers are written in pencil, are circled, and are located in the top right corner of the recto side of each folio. An additional foliation sequence is also present in parallel between ff 2-12; these numbers are also written in pencil, but are not circled, and are located in the same position as the main sequence.

mods.abstract: The file contains correspondence between the Finance Department of the Government of India, the British Residency at Bushire, the Political Agent at Bahrain, the Political Agent at Muscat, and the Sub-Postmaster at Bahrain. The Finance Department of the Government of India asks for views on security deposit and requests that accounts in the Post Office Savings Bank in Bahrain be abolished.
